website_summaries.verdict: Fewer reports of irritation or other reactions to this topical treatment by dogs, while still effective at keeping ticks and fleas off.
pros: Generally works well throughout the one-month treatment period to repel fleas and ticks
Irritation on application is minimal for many dogs, owners report
cons: Some owners report the topical treatment is not always effective
A few reports of irritation or other adverse reactions after application

customer_reviews.title: I will be finding out which flea and tick control brand they recommend. Use at your own risk
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Frontline Plus religiously for many years for my two border collies. Recently, one of them was exhibiting some unusual signs that prompted a visit to the vet where bloodworm was done and confirmed that she had Lyme disease (and a high level in her bloodstream). The vet told me that there have been several cases at their practice where Frontline has failed to protect dogs from ticks and Lyme disease. Currently, my dog is on her 30 day antibiotics, and when I go back for follow up tests, I will be finding out which flea and tick control brand they recommend. Use at your own risk!
customer_reviews.author: Karmadoggy

customer_reviews.title: Not Working! Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my dog and its not working at all. She has been on Frontline for two months. She is an 11 year old dog and I have always used Frontline and it has always worked not sure why this batch isn't working. I just pulled 50 fleas off of her I actually counted. Did the company change the product? I never had this problem before with Frontline. Very disappointed! My dog is miserable.
customer_reviews.author: Cherished Friend

customer_reviews.title: Best flea prevention for Virginia
customer_reviews.text: If you live in a moist climate like Virginia, this is the best of the 4 or 5 flea control products I've used. And it gets ticks that carry disease. I have 3 pets that go out in the yard for at least part of the day. I will not treat the yard bc that kills butterflies, dragon flies and lightening bugs. If you've been struggling with flea control, you know that they mutated to be resistant, and I recommend every 3 weeks treatment from July to killing frost, or tolerate fleas. But you won't have ticks if used every 4 weeks as directed. Collars are useless and excoriate their necks.
customer_reviews.author: teacher

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my dog - Fleas arrived
customer_reviews.text: I adopted a dog 3 months ago. When I got her, she'd been on oral flea meds and was flea-free. I switched to this topical Frontline - admittedly, because it was 40% cheaper than the orals and the reviews were good. I used 2 doses over the following 2 months and throughout, started finding fleas on her. I thought perhaps they'd just gotten on her from playing with another dog, and the Frontline would eventually kill them. Not the case. Yesterday I found 5 fleas while grooming her. I switched to an oral med and threw out the final 4 doses of the Frontline. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: DJames

customer_reviews.title: Trusted over similar topical or oral products
customer_reviews.text: I live in the hot, humid southeastern U.S. Been using for 2 years, no flea or tick issues. They key for success is that it has to be applied the same time every month. If you start on the 18th, do it again the next 18th of the month. No baths 3 days before or after application so that the skin can absorb properly, and you're good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Nc2MCNc

customer_reviews.title: Many dogs now have immunity to this, buy the newer version
customer_reviews.text: This formula doesn't work on a lot of dogs anymore because of immunity building up in fleas. It's too bad because it used to work like a charm but apparently their new more recent formula still works. My whole house got fleas and I was dealing with that for weeks because I was still using this product... :-(
customer_reviews.author: C. O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding at killing fleas
customer_reviews.text: Frontline is an outstanding product for killing fleas. Do not use this seller. The original box looked like a car ran over it and one of the six pack was leaking from the poor shipping quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Useless in Humid Climates
customer_reviews.text: I got a 6-pack to use for my dog and a week after the first dose her fleas were just as bad as before, if not worse. I spoke to a vet about this and she told me that in humid climates like the one we live in, Frontline is just as effective as pouring water on your dog. Do NOT waste your money if you live in a humid climate, just go to the vet and get whatever they recommend (it may cost more, but at least it won't be utterly useless).
customer_reviews.author: Isabella H.

customer_reviews.title: Vet Confirmed: it does not work
customer_reviews.text: I treated my two dogs. Three days later the fleas were back. Called my vet and they said that Frontline no longer works. The fleas have built an immunity to it. Frontline needs to change its formula and take this one off the market.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine R. Mckeon

customer_reviews.title: Why'd We Get a Dog Again?
customer_reviews.text: Answer: Because she's the best dog ever! But even good dogs get fleas sometimes. It took us a while to figure out that she was itching because of fleas- not just her usual allergies. We tried several solutions including bombing the house, spraying the carpet, putting powder on the carpet, and a flea collar. But the fleas kept coming back after a few days. So finally we got some fancier spray and this Frontline oil. We are finally flea-free. We should have just bought the good stuff from the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Does nothing
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for three months religiously and dogs still have flees. They are inside dogs and rarely outside, but this stuff seems to do absolutely nothing to flees. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Philip L.

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for two weeks!
customer_reviews.text: Frontline use to be top-of-the-line. This is the second time I've purchased it and it was not working. I had bathed my dog with natural flea and tick killing shampoo and then added the Frontline afterward. it works for a very short time and the fleas are still here! The dog is isolated to one room most of the time and our house is cleaned daily. We are not infested. Super disappointed. I feel like it's really hard to find stuff that works.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product * Best Price We've Found * Six Month Supply
customer_reviews.text: We have been using Frontline on our dogs for decades and after countless hours of research through the years, we've determined Amazon is the least expensive way for us to purchase Frontline Plus. We like the convenience of this package because we receive a six month supply (for one dog). No prescription is needed and application is simple. Please make sure that you order the correct dosage for your dog's weight.
customer_reviews.author: Vegan Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Multiple dogs.....we love the multi pack
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 indoor dogs and love the multiple pack. I've set up for auto delivery thru Amazon so I will never run out. FrontLine Plus works much better than the other brands and none of my dogs have ever had any issues/reactions to the product.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy M.

customer_reviews.title: Product doesn’t work for my dog.
customer_reviews.text: This product has not worked at all. My dog still has both fleas and ticks. (lots!). I plan to ask my vet for their recommendation and buy from them. Thank you reviewers for forwarding your vet’s advice. Product sitting in hot warehouse or pest immunity to product seems like reasonable explanation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work!
customer_reviews.text: We thought at first it just took longer than instructions said to kill the fleas, and for a while the problem did get better... But even if we applied the liquid twice a month, the fleas just got more aggressive. Total waste of money and of course 6 weeks later it's too late to return. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Zaurius

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this product, it doesn’t work and non refundable.
customer_reviews.text: Update: Amazon gave me a full refund. This product doesn’t work. I put on my dogs as soon as it was delivered and within a few days they are biting and scratching and we have found fleas on them. It’s been 10 days now and the package says to wait 30 days for next application. I want to return the product but it says it is not returnable. I am out $60 and I need to go to our vet now and purchase something that works. I’m very disappointed in this product. A complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Chantal J

customer_reviews.title: After 8 days still finding fleas on my dog
customer_reviews.text: Never before had any issues with fleas. After move to Cali 1 month ago the dog started to scratch. I found a flea on her. Bought this and wasted money. I work with dogs and know proper ways of applying it. Did everything according instructions on the package. First time trying this brand and after 8 days I still found fleas on my dog. Every day! Didn’t wash the dog before and after. Didn’t go any dog place in order to prevent getting new fleas. My dog never stopped scratching. How it’s possible? Zero effect and the producer says it’s 100% result!
customer_reviews.author: Maryna Volotovska

customer_reviews.title: Not Real Frontline, doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I read the Front line was the best, however, I've had horrible results. I spent over 150 dollars, for what appears to be no stronger than water. I won't be buying again from Amazon because I think it's fake.
customer_reviews.author: deborah s. garris

customer_reviews.title: Didn't get my money's worth
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this before and never had any issues. But my latest order had two vials that had leaked inside the sealed packaging. So, I paid for 6 but only got 4 usable ones. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply, no ticks
customer_reviews.text: No ticks yet (will update if that changes). We went on a hike and during the hike I spotted 4 ticks on Dog which did not burrow into his fur (each one I removed immediately). My dog has very thick fur and is a tick magnet, I have never actually seen a tick on top of his fur like that (even though he's had a lot) so I assume they would normally immediately burrow in. It has been over a week since this hike and we check him regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Compares
customer_reviews.text: I live in the country sometimes and there are a lot of fleas and ticks. I have a dog I like to hike with and nothing has ever REALLY deterred these pesky pests away from my dog like Frontline. I know it is a little pricey but again, I tried the cheap stuff to no avail. This stuff is it. Been using for more than a decade.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Wheeler, Attorney At Law

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a day
customer_reviews.text: This helped for a day. Then nothing. Maybe it was the shampoo we used the day before that actually worked. But this was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: N Dorsett

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, vet hospital highly discouraged product!
customer_reviews.text: My dog was getting fleas still with this product and when I called the vet they said they highly don't recommend this product. They said frontline has become so widely produced that the formula is very weak and no longer productive at preventing. The vet continued to say that they don't even sell it for that reason and don't recommend it to any pet parent. I ended up using a flea preventative that is in his Heartworm preventative medicine and it works way better!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonJunkie

customer_reviews.title: Frontline is worthless, don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work whatsoever on my dog. We just treated our cats with another brand of flea medicine and all of the fleas on them died within a few hours - the fleas on my dog have had no response whatsoever to Frontline in the last 3 days. In fact, it seems like some of the fleas from my cats have made a new home on my dog! Worthless product, wish I could get my money back
customer_reviews.author: Will Haun

customer_reviews.title: Good value and effective so far
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy the Bayern flea product, but decided to try the Frontline because it was cheaper. After the first month, I don’t have anything bad to say and it works as expected. The packaging is not as easy to as as the one from Bayern, but overall I think this is very good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Years (maybe decades) of use with no problems!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product for years and none of my dogs have had any trouble with it. My dogs have ranged from a 23 pound schnorkie to a 76 pd borzoi. My schnorkie hunts lizards in tall grass but is not bothered by any hitchhiking insects. I won't change from this brand -- it's trouble free, effective, and easy to use
customer_reviews.author: silversides

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use but does not make any difference to the fleas on my dog. I do not like to treat my dog with chemicals but fleas were so bad that I decided to try Frontline. Did not make any difference to the fleas. Hope it did not hurt my dog. It was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: Its difficult to get to the dogs skin with certain types of coats. Also, I haven't seen any fleas but have taken 4 ticks of his fur.. have not found anything attached to his skin yet but I'm skeptical so I'm having my yard sprayed for ticks and mosquitoes just incase.
customer_reviews.author: Box

customer_reviews.title: After several doses, I discovered fleas
customer_reviews.text: I’m very disappointed with this product. I’ve been in a 6 month subscription of this product for my corgi and he has had about 6 doses so far and I discovered this week that he has fleas. This product did not do its job of helping prevent my dog from getting them. I just cancelled my subscription and I’m immediately switching to another product after I take my dog to a vet. Never buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Luisito

customer_reviews.title: Gave them Diahreah didn't kill fleas
customer_reviews.text: Did not work, fleas active on dogs. Treated whole house, washed beds. Gave all my dogs diahreah
customer_reviews.author: Mackobubis

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of money to purchase 2 boxes for 2 dogs. I used it the 1st month yet noticed a few fleas. I thought I needed to give it more time. After returning from a 3 week trip my dogs were loaded with fleas. It was time again to re-dose. They still have fleas. It is horrible. I do not know if it was compromised by heat or just bad product. It does not appear this is a way for me to return/refund. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth D. Brubaker

customer_reviews.title: Not working
customer_reviews.text: This product has been used for 2 month. Waste of money. My dog woke u crying because he is covered in fleas. Worse than when he started the product. I have 2 dogs both still have bad infestation. I bought2 of the 6 month packs.
customer_reviews.author: CommentFromJohn

customer_reviews.title: Good results, good price
customer_reviews.text: We have tried several tick and flea products and have found Frontline Plus to be the most effective in our hot, sub-tropical climate. Although I am not a huge fan of putting chemicals on my pets, since we have used Frontline Plus our dogs never have fleas or ticks (whereas several of our friends and neighbors' pets do) so until someone comes up with a natural product that does the same thing we will continue to use this and the price is much better than at the vets' office.
customer_reviews.author: Roger S

customer_reviews.title: Always worked for my dog
customer_reviews.text: My parents used this type of flea and tick medication on their dogs and I now do on my own dog. We have never had skin irritation issues or flea and tick issues. I have found lone fleas on my dog but once I removed and check the rest of her body I couldn't find anymore. It kills them when they bite. It dries regularly on their back and I wait to reply after a give my dog a bath each month.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. Both dogs have fleas after i applied it. Urgh! Back to the flea collars. Which do work.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: This classic keeps on working !
customer_reviews.text: I've always used Frontline since it was invented -- multiple dogs over the years. It works for fleas in our areas and also discourages ticks. I used to get it at Costco but now must buy online as they have phased out Frontline in favor of some other products. I apply once a month and warn everyone not to pat the dogs for 48 hours. Also I don't swim the dogs for 48 hours.
customer_reviews.author: M. Woodyard

customer_reviews.title: This is the flea treatment I recommend where I work and what I use on my dog as well
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and I got it at a great price from amazon. I work at a pet store and we charge the same thing for only 3 months so I am really glad I got my frontline plus from amazon and not anywhere else. Got rid of the fleas I brought home from work in my work boots! UGH!! The frontline had us all better within 1 weeks time. I also sprinkled diatomaceous earth in my boots and around areas in the house I was paranoid they might be hiding. This is the flea treatment I use and recommend in the store where I work.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia S

customer_reviews.title: No allergic reactions with this
customer_reviews.text: I have a pug that is hypersensitive to many products, causing severe and immediate life threatening allergic reactions. Spending the summers in the Northwoods of Wisconsin make it essential I treat him to avoid ticks.....it is lyme disease country. Tried another brand first and had to race to the vet due to his reaction. Have used this with no reaction at all. Some people have commented that they believe Frontline has lost some of its effectiveness; I have not found this to be true...and trust me, in bear country we have more ticks than mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: My dog seems to get along with it!
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for fleas on my dog and have been for years. Someone told me recently to change brands every once in a while. When I am done with this box I plan to do it. She doesn't mind that I have to putit on her neck and push her coat aside to do it. Treats always come after!
customer_reviews.author: Shepainter1

customer_reviews.title: Did not kill fleas
customer_reviews.text: I have used Frontline Plus on my pets successfully in the past. I got a new puppy 5/16/20 and applied frontline. After each weekly bath I was seeing flees. After one month I reapplied. Same issue. Every bath I’d find fleas. I don’t know if this is a bad batch or not. I’m past my 30 day window to return but I would like to have a refund or replacement at least.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Brown

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only brand we get for our dogs and cats. I love that it not only protects from fleas and ticks, but also biting lice, which we sometimes have an issue with seasonally, living way out in the boonies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t jeopardize your dogs health. This doesn’t even work.
customer_reviews.text: This did not work on my dogs. I would not purchase this product again. Going forward I will only use natural treatments to rid my dogs of fleas. The risk of using toxins that aren’t effective is not one I’m willing to take.
customer_reviews.author: Lc

customer_reviews.title: Bug free dog
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for years, first on my German Shepherd and second on my Swedish Valhuund. Have never seen a bug tick, mosquito nats ever on either dog. Highly recommended. Plus, great price.
customer_reviews.author: SteveGord

customer_reviews.title: Very effective against ticks.
customer_reviews.text: I put the tick medication through the ringer today and I am incredibly happy with the result. My wife and I picked about 100 ticks of our dog which had bit him, got poisoned, and then attempted to flee to greener pastures. It was not 100% effective as we still found a handful dug in a few hours later but we also found dead ticks laying on the floor. I plan on purchasing Frontine in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Schwinler

customer_reviews.title: Cannot read instructions in font size 6
customer_reviews.text: I had to go online and search for the instructions. I have good eyesight. But, I could not read the packaging at all. Actually, my teenagers also could not read the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: ALBA G

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: Sorry if this is not a helpful review. Applied treatment to my 25-pound dog and she was lethargic for several days. I will not give her the full dose next month.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Does not work ... in the mountains and have to constantly pull ticks off my dogs!! I spoke to a veterinarian who says they no longer sell it because it does not work!!
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Always use this product on my dogs. It doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Always use this product on my dogs. It doesn't make me sick and it works. I have read negative reviews about it... but I believe people are buying the knock off ones which are cheaper. They don't work. I buy directly from credible sellers in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Diane G.

customer_reviews.title: The best product out there
customer_reviews.text: For the first year that my dog adopted me, we used all natural products but they really didn't do the trick. After checking with other dog lovers, I went with Frontline and have never been disappointed. My dog and I hike a lot and we live in "tick country." Frontline keeps her tick and flea free. Also, she sleeps on the bed with me and I would not be happy if we invited extra critters to join us. This product works. Amazon prices are more reasonable than I can find at my local pet store, and you can't go wrong with prime.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria108

customer_reviews.title: Made in France but looks fine
customer_reviews.text: What I received says Made in France. I don't know if that is unusual other than that other reviews complained about this product being made overseas. I gave it 5 stars because other than its providence, the product looks perfectly normal along with the usual monthly stickers and impossible to open packaging. I might have come home from the vet with this and not asked a question about it other than why this stuff is so expensive. I ordered from Amazon fulfilled by Amazon for some measure of safety as I expect Amazon wouldn't stock illicit products. The savings are great relative to pricing at the vets. I strongly recommend this product from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Greetings From DC

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: it doesn't work, I called Frontline customer service, they stating that they don't recognized the seller, I recommend to buy it from Frontline as a seller
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: No fleas or ticks with this product
customer_reviews.text: Our dog has never had fleas or ticks with this product. She is 9 years old and we live in a rural area with many deer, coyotes, fox and everything else that would have parasites. Frontline Plus definitely works.
customer_reviews.author: G-ma

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: Bath proof all month long. No sign of any infection. Hardest part is getting the dog's hair separated prior to applying the fluid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have two English setters who spend pretty much all their time outside, when we miss a month our dogs are covered in ticks but when we use this faithfully every month our dogs never have issues with ticks and fleas. a little pricey but a great product overall!
customer_reviews.author: crispysquash231

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck in Florida summers!!
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, this is the absolute best product for my dogs during the Florida summer flea/tick season! Wouldn’t use anything else, ever!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Great product, been using for 6 years.
customer_reviews.text: Kills the bugs and leaves the puppy happy. Looks for deals online of subscribe and save. Never had a bad experience with Frontline, that said make sure your always buying from a good seller - you wouldn't want some cheap knock off.
customer_reviews.author: WASTELAND RAVENTop Contributor: Board Games

customer_reviews.title: Purchased a 6 dose package.  Contained only 3.
customer_reviews.text: This product comes inside a sealed container. In the package I received half of the sealed containers did not have a Frontline dispenser in them.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Beck

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work... :(
customer_reviews.text: A week after I applied the drops I found three fleas running across my dog's face/head. He is still licking his paws a lot. I gave him a dish soap bath a few days after I saw the fleas (I wanted to be sure I did not wash the Frontline off him in case of the slight chance it worked even a little bit so I gave it time to work through his fur). There were numerous dead fleas floating in the water after soaking him with Dawn dish soap. This product does very little to deter fleas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as well as it once used to :/
customer_reviews.text: I've used Frontline for both of my dogs for years. I've never seen fleas or ticks on them ever. Then all of a sudden my dog gets 4 ticks and 2 rounds of fleas WITHIN THE SAME MONTH. I'm quite disappointed, as I used to rely on Frontline to get the job done. Living in Georgia, fleas and ticks are a year round issue and now I've lost my trust with frontline...
customer_reviews.author: K Fish

customer_reviews.title: Must Have.
customer_reviews.text: VERY HAPPY. Arrived before expected, safely packaged. As pictured and described. This product is amazing, best flea/tick drops ever.
customer_reviews.author: Ang Ruf

customer_reviews.title: I really like this product.
customer_reviews.text: I have used it on my dogs for over 30 years and it really works. I live in the south so if it works here it will work everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Lake House Granny

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my dog until I found a couple of fleas. He never liked the liquid on his back
customer_reviews.text: Fleas in LA are stronger than ever, but as far as I can notice this product works for my dog. I have a 18 months old, 30 pounds terrier and all good. Happy with this product. UPDATE (July 2015): after six months of using Frontline, I found a couple of fleas on my dog. I checked with the vet and it looks like fleas are now resistant to this product. I switched to Bravecto an problem solved. One pill every 3 months is all you need. A bit more expensive but way better.
customer_reviews.author: Anj

customer_reviews.title: GREAT - no ticks!
customer_reviews.text: We buy this every year for our dogs and they've never had any ticks. We live in the Great Plains, have a big backyard, and take them out for walks and hikes. It must work!
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: My dog appears to be allergic -- broke out in hives
customer_reviews.text: It appears one of my dogs is allergic -- she was very itchy and then broke out in hives two days after I dosed her and the other dog. She's still super itchy and I'm giving her benadryl regularly. I may go back to the Fiproguard, a cheaper Frontline knockoff, which I used for years with no issues. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Auntie Holly

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today! Great value for money compared w those pets supplier websites. Can't wait to try it on my pup next month.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT repel ticks!
customer_reviews.text: This does NOT repel ticks! I took my dog for a hike and over the following three days either pulled off the dog or found in bed (both alive and dead) SEVENTEEN ticks! (Yes, I counted). Now, maybe it kills the ticks after they bite the dog, but by then I fail to see the point. My poor pup has been miserable with itching for days and I'm worried sick about disease. Also this item is not returnable. I'm sticking to Advantix from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Camus

customer_reviews.title: We were using Frontline from the internet but the dog ...
customer_reviews.text: We were using Frontline from the internet but the dog kept getting fleas. We had to do a full court press with yard spraying, vacuuming, washing, and finally a vet prescription of Comfortis to get things under control. After talking with someone I know who provides pharmaceuticals to veterinarians, it turns out that over-the-counter Frontline is not as strong as the prescription stuff from a vet. So, you can save money buying Frontline on the internet but take a risk that you might still get a flea infestation.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Turner

customer_reviews.title: No more fleas
customer_reviews.text: Works great... if u already have fleas it will take a month or so to rid them completely because they're in your home/carpet. After making the mistake of starting treatments after the weather turned warm I now i start treating my dogs early Spring when its still cold out. I haven't seen a flea since making this change. My vet recommends treating year round but I stop for the Winter months to save a little money. If u live somewhere that's warm year round... probably not a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: mustluvdogs

customer_reviews.title: not worth it
customer_reviews.text: spent a lot of money on this and it did not keep the fleas or ticks off.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for many years for four dogs so far and it has always worked.
customer_reviews.author: Maria T-M

customer_reviews.title: Gotch ya!@
customer_reviews.text: Have used this brand for years and found it to be true to its claims. The one time a flea was found on my dog it was so slow it could be picked off by finger. Actually had a good laugh that it was so slow.
customer_reviews.author: Sister Louise

customer_reviews.title: Say goodbye to fleas.
customer_reviews.text: We live in Florida. The fleas are bad. Frontline is the only product I have found that keep the little bloodsuckers off of my baby. I would recommemd this product to anyone that wants their pets to be flea free.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great product, subscribe and save more $$
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? It works! My dog has never had fleas or ticks! AND by subscribing to this, I save $$ versus buying it from other on line companies.
customer_reviews.author: Steelhorzz

customer_reviews.title: Gonna try something else.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this before, but it didn't work this time. I think it was a bad batch. I was very dissatisfied with the product in general and the amount of time Frontline required before processing an exchange. Thankfully, Amazon has amazing customer service and processed my refund promptly. I couldn't stand to watch my dog scratch anymore.
customer_reviews.author: TechProTips

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it for years and never had a problem with ticks. Just need to make sure you put it on the same time every month. The little containers however can be troublesome at times. When opening tap the bottom on a table to get the liquid out of the tube. Hold the tube above and below the break point with the paper side facing you. Then bend the top back towards you. This method helps prevent anything from coming out when opening. Once before we started taking these steps my wife got sprayed in the eye and was very painful.
customer_reviews.author: Lake Rat

customer_reviews.title: Will not work for California flea?
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this product twice and used it on my dog. After months, the poor dog still suffer from fleas. I have to take the dog to the vet. The vet told me that this product will not work for California flea! Is it true? And why the product can not be refund when it is not working!
customer_reviews.author: Wenpei Chou

customer_reviews.title: Great Price - straight from the source
customer_reviews.text: Shopped around at our local stores and they couldn't come close to the price paid on here - directly form Frontline. No need to worry about getting fake or tainted versions. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Natroneous

customer_reviews.title: Did not work ? Counterfeit brand
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. After 2 months of using Frontline Plus on my dog, he still has fleas. We just returned from the Vet’s office and was told that Frontline Plus wasn’t working. This could be a counterfeit brand but who knows. Can’t return it and am now out of 50.00 and my poor dog still has fleas. Purchased another brand but not from Amazon, we’ll wait and see on that one.
customer_reviews.author: Bretanha

customer_reviews.title: Trusted product, works well
customer_reviews.text: I used Frontline Plus on my 3-year-old beagle for the first 2 years I had him - then I switched to K-9 Advantix because it was on sale - that was a mistake! My beagle had a skin reaction to the K-9 Advantix and after talking with the vet - he recommended we go back to Frontline Plus. I'll never switch again! Also - I was told that if you give your dog Interceptor (heartworm pills) Frontline Plus is the preferred flea product - I'm not sure what the connection is between the two, but since it came from my vet, I believe it and will never switch products again!
customer_reviews.author: Elo

customer_reviews.title: Not working like it has in the past
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my dogs and it didn't seem to do anything to the fleas. I've used this brand before from the stores and it's worked. I'm not sure what happened with this batch.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Sherrod

customer_reviews.title: Frontline-worth it
customer_reviews.text: It gets rid of the fleas n ticks so I am great with this product. Ordered it before and it was no muss, no fuss. Easy to apply.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: This really seemed to work well and the price was considerably cheaper than I would get at the vet's office easy application
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: it is either bad batches or the epa got involved and demanded changes ...
customer_reviews.text: Flea outbreak this year!First time in 25 yrs ...Just Not the same product! Used it continuously on all pets ;it is either bad batches or the epa got involved and demanded changes on their formala because it just does not work...Not we had to use flea bats;spray &bombs aND finally new Collars
customer_reviews.author: CHERYL ANN CUTHBERTSON

customer_reviews.title: Not very effective
customer_reviews.text: Not very Ineffective, dog still got fleas this fall. Although it was manageable and didnt last so perhaps it would have been much worse had I not used this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. D.

customer_reviews.title: Frontline Plus Dog
customer_reviews.text: We have a puppy that goes outside to do her business. I noticed that she was scratching and biting so I looked at her a little bit closer and saw one of those evil little buggers running across her belly. I ordered the frontline and put it on her as soon as the driver dropped it at the door. A day later and she is scratching significantly less and I haven't seen one on her since. It has been 3 weeks since that time. I would definitly recommend this product to keep your dog safe from fleas, ticks and the diseases they carry.
customer_reviews.author: Wrecho

customer_reviews.title: I question if this product actually contains active ingredients because  it has been ineffective!
customer_reviews.text: I have used Frontline plus on my dogs for years. This purchase was ineffective on my dogs, and I question if there are actually active ingredients in it. Also on my last Frontline plus purchase from Amazon for my cats, Amazon notified this was a defective product and sent another package of Frontline Plus! I believe this latest purchase of Frontline Plus for dogs has the same issue!!! How are we as consumers able to tell if it is fake and a defective product?
customer_reviews.author: John S. Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: No longer works. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Despite my dog being on the low end of the weight range, this product does not seem to help at all with fleas. I even reapplied the product two weeks later, because we bathed her (which normally does not matter with these types of meds) but I still find fleas on her and she is scratching at licking them all the time. I will not be buying this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Nate & Eliza

customer_reviews.title: Ineffective batch!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this 8-pack (23-44 lbs) of Frontline! I've always had good results with Frontline Plus products in the past, but this time has not been effective. Not commenting on any other sized packs.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great price versus vet
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work (never had an issue with fleas or ticks), great price.
customer_reviews.author: KJC

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy our flea stuff from the store and this was a much better deal
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Standish

customer_reviews.title: Effective for more than 15 years
customer_reviews.text: I used to use this to protect my large German shepherd mix up until the day he passed away at 15.5 years old. He never had any issues with fleas while on this product. I recently adopted two small dogs, about 20 pounds each. I use one packet to treat both of them. I bought some 1 cc syringes and some dispensing needles and just split the content of one pack evenly between my two dogs. Saves me a lot of money AND they get a proper dosage of the medicine.
customer_reviews.author: Ali Etezadkhah

customer_reviews.title: Still have fleas after 2 months of use
customer_reviews.text: After using for 2 months, following the directions, my dog has consistently had fleas.
customer_reviews.author: Statler

customer_reviews.title: Frontline fleas product cancelled scheduled shipments
customer_reviews.text: Great flea product but had to cancel recurring order because our dog passed away
customer_reviews.author: Joann Payne

customer_reviews.title: protect your dogs health
customer_reviews.text: trusted brand and perfect for taking care of your pets at home
customer_reviews.author: a grissman

customer_reviews.title: Simply doesn't work anymore.
customer_reviews.text: It just simply doesn't work anymore! Applied it on my dog, and 3 days later I checked with a lice comb and found 3 live fleas within 2 minutes... Save your money, visit your vet and get some flea meds that are being taken by mouth. I am now using Comfortis for my 22 lbs poodle mix, and within 24hrs the scratching and biting his tail stopped. Yes, it is more expensive (about 2x), but why spend +$60 if it doesn't work?
customer_reviews.author: Axel Niedergesaess

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for many years on our dogs. They do not have a bad reaction and I have not found any fleas on them.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Marcotte

customer_reviews.title: Lured in by the cost, but this stuff does ...
customer_reviews.text: Lured in by the cost, but this stuff does not work. I tried it for a couple of months, which ended in a full flea infestation in my house. it never even touched the fleas on my dog. I think it made them stronger. I just got NexGard from my vet, and within less than a day I could not find a single flea on my dog. Frontline may have worked at one time, but not on the fleas in my neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: In just two days all fleas were gone.
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to administer to my dog. Works really well. My dog didn’t even notice anything.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Frontline
customer_reviews.text: Have used Frontline for many years with multiple dogs. Works well. This 8 month package was a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: B. G. Smith

product_meta.title: FRONTLINE Plus Flea and Tick Treatment for Medium Dogs (23-44 Pounds)
product_meta.description: Size:6 DosesFRONTLINE Plus for Dogs has been trusted by veterinarians for flea and tick control for dogs for nearly 20 years. Made with 2 tough killing ingredients, fipronil and (S)-methoprene – one to kill adult fleas and ticks and the second to kill flea eggs and larvae – this fast-acting, long-lasting protection provides flea and tick control for dogs and puppies 8 weeks and older, 23-44 lbs. Its long-lasting formula is stored in the oil glands of the pet’s skin to give non-stop flea and tick protection for a full 30 days.
feature_bullets: Waterproof flea and tick treatment for dogs: Frontline Plus for Dogs provides waterproof, fast-acting, long-lasting flea and tick treatment and control for your dog. This product is approved for use on dogs 23-44 lbs.

Break the flea life cycle with frontline: Frontline flea and tick treatment for dogs kills adult fleas plus flea eggs and larvae to stop existing infestations and prevent establishment of new infestations.
Kills fleas and ticks: Frontline flea and tick treatment for dogs kills fleas, flea eggs, lice, and ticks. This flea and tick treatment kills ticks, including those that may transmit Lyme disease

Trusted flea and tick protection for dogs: Frontline has been trusted by veterinarians for nearly 20 years. Made with 2 tough killing ingredients, fipronil and (S)-methoprene – one to kill adult fleas and ticks and the second to kill flea eggs and larvae – this fast-acting, long-lasting protection provides flea and tick control for dogs and puppies 8 weeks and older.

Lasting flea and tick protection: Frontline's long-lasting formula is stored in the oil glands of the pet’s skin to give non-stop flea and tick protection for a full 30 days. Frontline flea and tick treatment for dogs works non-stop for a full 30 days. A 6-dose supply lasts for 6 months.
If you are not satisfied with Frontline Plus for any reason, please contact the Boehringer-Ingelheim Animal Health Customer Care Team at: 1-800-660-1842.
